channel.title: Paper 1 on IB English - Antonio Kam
channel.description: Recent content in Paper 1 on IB English - Antonio Kam

item.title: Paper 1 Formative - Year 13 Term 1
item.description: Summary + Self-reported Feedback When going for your examples/evidence, please be more specific Instead of just the boy's face showing helplessness, say how this works (for example, the boy's mouth is wide open with half-closed eyes - looks very weak cupped in his mother's eyes etc) Make sure to mention more on PAF/COP/COR at the start of the text and be more explicit when pointing these things out Instead of going for something on a global scale when analysing, analyse how it affects the text instead.

item.title: Books
item.description: Introduction In ‘The Pleasure of Books’, a radio address by William Lyon Phelps, figurative and rhetorical devices are used in order to offer comfort to readers, who had just gone through the great depression. Phelps also makes assumptions that listeners enjoy reading books, and have the means and desire to build a collection of them. Through this, Phelps gets his audience hooked into reading and experiencing the unique feeling of reading books.
